SELECT * FROM sys_code where cd_name like '%'||#{map.search}||'%'
and cd_g_code = #{map.group}
and cd_g_code = '*'
order by cd_ordr
select a.* from sys_code a where cd_g_code = '*' and cd_code > '*' order by cd_ordr
mapper.insert: insert into sys_code(cd_code, cd_name, cd_g_code, cd_ordr, cd_ref1, cd_ref2, cd_ref3, inst_date, inst_user, updt_date, updt_user) values(#{id},#{name},#{pid})

MERGE INTO sys_code S USING DUAL ON (S.cd_g_code = #{cd_g_code} and S.cd_code = #{cd_code}) WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET S.cd_name = #{cd_name} , S.cd_ordr = #{cd_ordr} WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN INSERT (S.cd_code, S.cd_name, S.cd_g_code, S.cd_ordr, S.cd_ref1, S.cd_ref2, S.cd_ref3) VALUES (#{cd_code},#{cd_name},#{cd_g_code},#{cd_ordr},#{cd_ref1},#{cd_ref2},#{cd_ref3} )
delete from sys_code where cd_code = #{cd_code} and cd_code = #{cd_code}
